alert.note: Alert for Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 7:55PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Adams and southeastern Lincoln Counties through 830 PM PDT... At 755 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles northeast of Ritzville, or 26 miles west of Cheney, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sprague. This includes Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 234 and 245. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
